answers.answer: Sounds like headaches to me. If they are new to you, you should see a doctor but remember headaches are common common common and often start in your teens. Have you started any new medications? contraceptives? drinking more coffee, energy drinks?Hair coming out? Have you had an illness or major stress in the last 6 months? The hair can go into a resting phase then all fall out at the same time later a few months down the track.
Umm well i have to Two kids and i started birth control pills in jume after i had my duaghter but other then that nothing new. I havent gotten sick or anything.

Go to a doctor.  Let them do a MRI which is standard now before prescribing migraine medication.  If it is determined that it is migraines, they will put you on medicine that will help.  Headaches can sometimes be a sign of something more serious.  Most of the time, they are not, but the MRI will give the doctors the best information.  Trust me, my family has been dealing with this for the last 4 months.  First my daughter had severe headaches that lasted several weeks, they discovered that she had had a stroke, then my step father started having headaches and they found cancer.  Don't wait.
I agree with MilanMiller that you should go see your doc.  A month is too long for headaches to recur.

question: I am a 20 year old and Aaout a month ago i started getting really bad headaches. My head would be tender in some spots to touch like someone pulled your hair really hard and its sore afterwards. Also i notice my hair is coming out alot more then it should. I havent notice anything else blurry vision or anything else, I just dont knwo what it is. Diabetes run in the family and i wonder if it mioght be related to that. Im just really confussed and not sure what to do.Many thx
title: Worried/Cancer Maybe
